member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreDataAttribute
member.summary: Defines an attribute to mark a property on a record class as 'data'.
member.remarks: Marking a property as 'data' means that the property is not a key and not a vector. But optionally, this property can have an associated vector field containing an embedding for this data. The characteristics defined here influence how the property is treated by the vector store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreDataAttribute.IsIndexed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this data property is indexed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreDataAttribute.IsFullTextIndexed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this data property is indexed for full-text search.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreDataAttribute.StorageName
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name to use for the property in storage, if different from the property name.
member.remarks: For example, the property name might be "MyProperty" and the storage name might be "my_property".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreKeyAttribute
member.summary: Defines an attribute to mark a property on a record class as the key under which the record is stored in a vector store.
member.remarks: The characteristics defined here influence how the property is treated by the vector store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreKeyAttribute.StorageName
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name to use for the property in storage, if different from the property name.
member.remarks: For example, the property name might be "MyProperty" and the storage name might be "my_property".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorAttribute
member.summary: Defines an attribute to mark a property on a record class as a vector.
member.remarks: The characteristics defined here influence how the property is treated by the vector store.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The number of dimensions that the vector has.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorAttribute.Dimensions
member.summary: Gets the number of dimensions that the vector has.
member.remarks: This property is required when creating collections, but can be omitted if not using that functionality. If not provided when trying to create a collection, create will fail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorAttribute.IndexKind
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of index to use.
member.value: The default value varies by database type. See the documentation of your chosen database connector for more information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorAttribute.DistanceFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance function to use when comparing vectors.
member.value: The default value varies by database type. See the documentation of your chosen database connector for more information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorAttribute.StorageName
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name to use for the property in storage, if different from the property name.
member.remarks: For example, the property name might be "MyProperty" and the storage name might be "my_property".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction
member.summary: Defines a list of well-known distance functions that can be used to compare vectors.
member.remarks: Not all Vector Store connectors support all distance functions, and some connectors might support additional distance functions that aren't defined here. For more information on what's supported, see the documentation for each connector.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.CosineSimilarity
member.summary: Specifies the function that measures the cosine (angular) similarity between two vectors.
member.remarks: Cosine similarity measures only the angle between the two vectors, without taking into account the length of the vectors. ConsineSimilarity = 1 - CosineDistance. -1 means vectors are opposite. 0 means vectors are orthogonal. 1 means vectors are identical.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.CosineDistance
member.summary: Specifies the function that measures the cosine (angular) distance between two vectors.
member.remarks: CosineDistance = 1 - CosineSimilarity. 2 means vectors are opposite. 1 means vectors are orthogonal. 0 means vectors are identical.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.DotProductSimilarity
member.summary: Specifies the dot product similarity function, which measures both the length and angle between two vectors.
member.remarks: The higher the value, the more similar the vectors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.NegativeDotProductSimilarity
member.summary: Specifies the negative dot product similarity function, which measures both the length and angle between two vectors.
member.remarks: The value of NegativeDotProduct = -1 * DotProductSimilarity. The higher the value, the greater the distance between the vectors and the less similar the vectors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.EuclideanDistance
member.summary: Specifies the function that measures the Euclidean distance between two vectors.
member.remarks: Also known as l2-norm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.EuclideanSquaredDistance
member.summary: Specifies the function that measures the Euclidean squared distance between two vectors.
member.remarks: Also known as l2-squared.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.HammingDistance
member.summary: Specifies the function that measures the number of differences between vectors at each dimension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.ManhattanDistance
member.summary: Specifies the function that measures the Manhattan distance between two vectors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind
member.summary: Defines a list of well-known index types that can be used to index vectors.
member.remarks: Not all Vector Store connectors support all index types, and some connectors might support additional index types that aren't defined here. For more information on what's supported, see the documentation for each connector.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.Hnsw
member.summary: Specifies the Hierarchical Navigable Small World, which performs an approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) search.
member.remarks: This search has lower accuracy than exhaustive k nearest neighbor, but is faster and more efficient.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.Flat
member.summary: Specifies the brute force search to find the nearest neighbors.
member.remarks: This search calculates the distances between all pairs of data points, so it has a linear time complexity that grows directly proportional to the number of points. It's also referred to as "exhaustive k nearest neighbor" in some databases. This search has high recall accuracy, but is slower and more expensive than HNSW. It works better with smaller datasets.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.IvfFlat
member.summary: Specifies an Inverted File with Flat Compression.
member.remarks: This search is designed to enhance search efficiency by narrowing the search area through the use of neighbor partitions or clusters. Also referred to as approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) search.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.DiskAnn
member.summary: Specifies the Disk-based Approximate Nearest Neighbor algorithm, which is designed for efficiently searching for approximate nearest neighbors (ANN) in high-dimensional spaces.
member.remarks: The primary focus of DiskANN is to handle large-scale datasets that can't fit entirely into memory, leveraging disk storage to store the data while maintaining fast search times.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.QuantizedFlat
member.summary: Specifies an index that compresses vectors using DiskANN-based quantization methods for better efficiency in the kNN search.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.Dynamic
member.summary: Specifies a dynamic index that switches automatically from to indexes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollectionDefinition
member.summary: Describes the properties of a record in a vector store collection.
member.remarks: Each property contains additional information about how the property will be treated by the vector store.

member.summary: Gets or sets the list of properties that are stored in the record.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollectionDefinition.EmbeddingGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the default embedding generator for vector properties in this collection.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The type of the property. Required when using a record type of Dictionary<string, object?> (dynamic mapping), but can be omitted when mapping any other .NET type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreDataProperty.IsIndexed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this data property is indexed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreDataProperty.IsFullTextIndexed

member.summary: Defines a base property class for properties on a vector store record.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreProperty.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property on the data model.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreProperty.StorageName
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name to use for the property in storage, if different from the property name.
member.remarks: For example, the property name might be "MyProperty" and the storage name might be "my_property". This property is only respected by implementations that don't support a well-known serialization mechanism like JSON, in which case the attributes used by that serialization system will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreProperty.Type

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorProperty.EmbeddingGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the default embedding generator to use for this property.
member.remarks: If not set, embedding generation will be performed in the database, if supported by your connector. Otherwise, if your database does not support embedding generation, only pregenerated embeddings can be used (for example, ReadOnlyMemory<float>).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreVectorProperty.Dimensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of dimensions that the vector has.
member.remarks: This property is required when creating collections, but can be omitted if not using that functionality. If not provided when trying to create a collection, create will fail.

member.summary: Gets or sets the desired embedding type (for example, Embedding<Half>) for cases where the default (typically Embedding<float>) isn't suitable.

member.summary: Gets or sets the additional target property to do the text or keyword search on. The property must have full text indexing enabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IKeywordHybridSearchable`1
member.summary: Contains a method for performing a hybrid search using a vector and keywords.
member.typeparam: The record data model to use for retrieving data from the store.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IKeywordHybridSearchable`1.HybridSearchAsync``1(``0,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.String},System.Int32,Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions{`0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Performs a hybrid search for records that match the given embedding and keywords, after applying the provided filters.
member.typeparam: The type of the input value on which to perform the vector similarity search.
member.param: The value on which to perform the similarity search. See the remarks section for more details.
A collection of keywords to search the store with.
The maximum number of results to return.
The options that control the behavior of the search.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The records found by the hybrid search, including their result scores.
member.remarks:
The types supported for the vary based on the provider being used and the embedding generation configured:
A or (for images, sound...) if an appropriate has been configured that accepts that type as input. For example, register an that accepts as input in your dependency injection container, and then pass in a argument to this method; the argument will be automatically passed to the to generate the embedding and perform the search. Some databases support generating embeddings at the database side. In this case, you can pass in a or without configuring an with Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData. The provider will simply send your argument to the database as-is for embedding generation.
Arbitrary .NET types can also be passed in as long as an appropriate has been configured; for example, you can create your own that accepts your own custom types as input, and uses another to generate embedding from multiple properties. For .NET types beyond and , you must use the generic in your record definition.
To work with embeddings directly, pass in a or a .NET array of the appropriate type. Most providers support at least ReadOnlyMemory<float> and float[], but some support other types (for example, ReadOnlyMemory<Half>, ). Some providers might also support their own custom types as well, for example, to represent sparse embeddings. Consult your provider's documentation for supported types.
If you're using directly in your code, that type returns an (for example, Embedding{float}), which can also be passed in directly, as long as the provider supports the specific embedding type. However, consider registering your with the provider instead and pass in the input type (for example, ).

member.returns: The records found by the vector search, including their result scores.
member.remarks:
The types supported for the vary based on the provider being used and the embedding generation configured:
A or (for images, sound...) if an appropriate has been configured that accepts that type as input. For example, register an that accepts as input in your dependency injection container, and then pass in a argument to this method; the argument will be automatically passed to the to generate the embedding and perform the search. Some databases support generating embeddings at the database side. In this case, you can pass in a or without configuring an with Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData. The provider will simply send your argument to the database as-is for embedding generation.
Arbitrary .NET types can also be passed in as long as an appropriate has been configured; for example, you can create your own that accepts your own custom types as input, and uses another to generate embedding from multiple properties. For .NET types beyond and , you must use the generic in your record definition.
To work with embeddings directly, pass in a or a .NET array of the appropriate type. Most providers support at least ReadOnlyMemory<float> and float[], but some support other types (for example, ReadOnlyMemory<Half>, ). Some providers might also support their own custom types as well, for example, to represent sparse embeddings. Consult your provider's documentation for supported types.
If you're using directly in your code, that type returns an (for example, Embedding{float}), which can also be passed in directly, as long as the provider supports the specific embedding type. However, consider registering your with the provider instead and pass in the input type (for example, ).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStore
member.summary: Represents a vector store that contains collections of records.

remarks.para: This type can be used with collections of any schema type, but requires you to provide schema information when getting a collection.
Unless otherwise documented, implementations of this abstract base class can be expected to be thread-safe, and can be used concurrently from multiple threads.

member.returns: A new instance for managing the records in the collection.

member.summary: Gets a record from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists. Returns null if the record is not found.
member.param: The unique ID associated with the record to get.
Optional options for retrieving the record.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The record if found, otherwise null.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollection`2.GetAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.RecordRetrievalOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a batch of records from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists.
member.param: The unique IDs associated with the record to get.
Optional options for retrieving the records.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The records associated with the specified unique keys.

remarks.para: The exact method of retrieval is implementation-specific and can vary based on database support. The default implementation of this method retrieves the records one after the other, but implementations which supporting batching can override to provide a more efficient implementation.
Only found records are returned, so the result set might be smaller than the requested keys.
This method throws for any issues other than records not being found.

member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollection`2.DeleteAsync(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes a record from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists.
member.param: The unique ID associated with the record to remove.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The unique identifier for the record.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason other than that the record does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollection`2.DeleteAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes a batch of records from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists.
member.param: The unique IDs associated with the records to remove.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A that completes when the records have been deleted.

remarks.para: The exact method of deleting is implementation-specific and can vary based on database support. The default implementation of this method deletes the records one after the other, but implementations which supporting batching can override to provide a more efficient implementation.

If a record isn't found, it is ignored and the batch succeeds. If any record can't be deleted for any other reason, the operation throws. Some records might have already been deleted while others might not have, so the entire operation should be retried.

member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason other than that a record does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollection`2.UpsertAsync(`1,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Upserts a record into the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists. If the record already exists, it is updated. If the record does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The record to upsert.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollection`2.UpsertAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`1},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Upserts a batch of records into the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists. If the record already exists, it is updated. If the record does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The records to upsert.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .

remarks.para: The exact method of upserting the batch is implementation-specific and can vary based on database support.

Similarly, the error behavior can vary across databases: where possible, the batch should be upserted atomically, so that any errors cause the entire batch to be rolled back. Where not supported, some records might be upserted while others are not. If key properties are set by the user, then the entire upsert operation is idempotent, and can simply be retried again if an error occurs. However, if store-generated keys are in use, the upsert operation is no longer idempotent; in that case, if the database doesn't guarantee atomicity, retrying could cause duplicate records to be created.

Implementations of should implement this method in a way which performs embedding generation once for the batch, rather than generating an embedding for each record separately. This is why a default implementation that calls is not provided.

member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreCollection`2.GetAsync(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`1,System.Boolean}},System.Int32,Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.FilteredRecordRetrievalOptions{`1},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets matching records from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists.
member.param: The predicate to filter the records.
The maximum number of results to return.
Options for retrieving the records.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The records that match the given predicate.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.

member.remarks: Where possible, this value maps to the "db.system.name" attribute defined in the OpenTelemetry Semantic Conventions for database calls and systems; see . Example: redis, sqlite, mysql.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Verify.FilenameRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[^.]+\\.[^.]+$
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match a character other than '.' atomically at least once.
Match '.'.
Match a character other than '.' greedily at least once.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.
